symbols.name: useUrlSync
symbols.summary: URL State Synchronization Hook
symbols.docstring:
URL State Synchronization Hook
Synchronizes Zustand catalog store state with URL parameters for:
- Shareable URLs
- Browser back/forward navigation
- Page refresh state preservation
URL Parameters:
- view: 'grid' | 'list' | 'master-detail'
- tab: 'catalog' | 'data'
- q: search query
- formFactor: form factor filter
- manufacturer: manufacturer filter
- maxPrice: price range filter

symbols.name: useBulkIngestionJob
symbols.summary: React Query hook for polling bulk ingestion job status
symbols.docstring:
React Query hook for polling bulk ingestion job status
This hook automatically polls the bulk ingestion status endpoint
every 2 seconds while the job is running, and stops when complete.
It supports pagination for per-URL status data.

symbols.name: useFieldValues
symbols.summary: Hook to fetch existing values for a field (for autocomplete)

symbols.name: ViewMode

Catalog View State Management
This store manages the state for the Listings Catalog View, including:
- Active view mode (grid, list, master-detail)
- Active tab (catalog, data)
- Filter state (search, form factor, manufacturer, price)
- Compare selections for Master-Detail view
- Dialog states for details and quick edit

symbols.name: SummaryCard
symbols.summary: Reusable summary card component for displaying key metrics
symbols.docstring:
Reusable summary card component for displaying key metrics
Used in detail page hero section and potentially other locations
for consistent display of summary information.
@example
```tsx
<SummaryCard
title="Listing Price"
value="$599.99"
size="medium"
/>
<SummaryCard
title="Composite Score"
value={8.5}
subtitle="Very Good"
variant="success"
/>
```

```tsx
<ValuationTabPage listing={listing} />
```

symbols.name: CpuTooltipContent
symbols.summary: CPU tooltip content component
symbols.docstring:
CPU tooltip content component
Displays rich CPU information in EntityTooltip hover card:
- CPU name and manufacturer
- Core/thread count
- TDP and clock speeds
- Performance metrics (CPU Mark, Single-Thread, iGPU)
- Release year
@example
```tsx
<EntityTooltip
entityType="cpu"
entityId={cpu.id}
tooltipContent={(data) => <CpuTooltipContent cpu={data} />}
>
Intel Core i5-12400
</EntityTooltip>
```

symbols.name: GpuTooltipContent
symbols.summary: GPU tooltip content component
symbols.docstring:
GPU tooltip content component
Displays rich GPU information in EntityTooltip hover card:
- GPU name and manufacturer
- VRAM capacity and type
- TDP and core count
- Performance metrics (GPU Mark)
@example
```tsx
<EntityTooltip
entityType="gpu"
entityId={gpu.id}
tooltipContent={(data) => <GpuTooltipContent gpu={data} />}
>
NVIDIA RTX 3060
</EntityTooltip>
```

symbols.name: formatNumber

symbols.name: RamSpecTooltipContent
symbols.summary: RAM specification tooltip content component
symbols.docstring:
RAM specification tooltip content component
Displays rich RAM specification information in EntityTooltip hover card:
- Capacity and generation (DDR4/DDR5)
- Speed (MHz)
- Module configuration
- Latency (CL)
@example
```tsx
<EntityTooltip
entityType="ram-spec"
entityId={ramSpec.id}
tooltipContent={(data) => <RamSpecTooltipContent ramSpec={data} />}
>
32GB DDR4 3600MHz
</EntityTooltip>
```

symbols.name: StorageProfileTooltipContent
symbols.summary: Storage profile tooltip content component
symbols.docstring:
Storage profile tooltip content component
Displays rich storage profile information in EntityTooltip hover card:
- Capacity and medium (SSD/HDD/NVMe)
- Interface and form factor
- Read/write speeds (if available)
@example
```tsx
<EntityTooltip
entityType="storage-profile"
entityId={storageProfile.id}
tooltipContent={(data) => <StorageProfileTooltipContent storageProfile={data} />}
>
1TB NVMe SSD
</EntityTooltip>
```

3. Perform actions (sort, filter, edit)
4. Check console for performance metrics
